task.title: Choosing your Generic Container
task.shortdesc: HTML has two types of generic containers: an in-line generic container (<span>) and a block-level generic container (<div>). The generic container you choose will depend on the type of information you want to contain.

taskbody.prereq:
In order to choose your generic container, you will need the following:
Text editor
HTML document
Selection from document that you would like to "contain"
taskbody.context: Generic containers allow you to select sections of content (often text). You should only use generic containers if there is no applicable semantic element. Unless otherwise defined in a CSS stylesheet, <span> and <div> don't change the visual presentation of their selection.
